title: Simple baked sweet potato with steamed carrots
ingredients: 1 pound carrots, peeled and cut into 2-inch pieces
1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped (or 1 teaspoon dried)
1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup (optional, for drizzling)
instructions: 1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil. 2. Scrub the sweet potatoes thoroughly under running water and pat dry. Pierce each potato 4-5 times with a fork to allow steam to escape during baking. 3. Rub each sweet potato with olive oil and sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. Place them on the prepared baking sheet. 4. Bake the sweet potatoes for 45-55 minutes, or until they are tender when pierced with a fork. The exact time will depend on the size of your potatoes. 5. While the sweet potatoes are baking, prepare the carrots. About 15 minutes before the potatoes are done, fill a medium pot with 1-2 inches of water and place a steamer basket inside. Bring the water to a boil over high heat. 6. Add the carrot pieces to the steamer basket, cover with a lid, and steam for 8-12 minutes until tender but still slightly firm. Check by piercing with a fork. 7. Once the carrots are done, drain any excess water and return them to the pot. Add 2 tablespoons of butter, remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and parsley. Toss gently to coat. 8. When the sweet potatoes are done, remove them from the oven and let cool for 2-3 minutes. Cut a slit lengthwise down the center of each potato and gently press the ends to open. 9. Top each sweet potato with a small pat of the remaining butter (about 1/4 tablespoon each) and optional garlic powder. Drizzle with honey or maple syrup if desired. 10. Serve the baked sweet potatoes alongside the steamed carrots on individual plates or a serving platter. Enjoy immediately while hot.
required_appliances: steamer basket or pot with lid
description: A wholesome, naturally sweet side dish featuring tender baked sweet potatoes and perfectly steamed carrots, seasoned simply with butter and herbs. This nutritious combination is easy to prepare and pairs well with any protein.
